rules: Rule1: If a severe drought occurs, then the coal power plant is not active
Rule2: Either a severe drought occurs or a heat wave occurs
Rule3: If a heat wave occurs, then the coal power plant is not active

Rule4: Either the governor activates the national guard, or if the governor declares an energy emergency, then under the condition that the absence of federal funding does not result in solar research not receiving government funding, the energy department implements emergency measures
Rule5: If the EPA finds the renewable energy facility in compliance, then the renewable energy facility does not violate EPA regulations
Rule6: If the EPA issues certification to the renewable energy facility, then the EPA finds the renewable energy facility in compliance
Rule7: If Congress passes the renewable energy bill, then when federal funding is not available, solar research does not receive government funding
Rule8: Either Congress passes the renewable energy bill or the president vetoes the renewable energy bill

Rule9: If the congressional committee reviews the energy contract bid, then should neither a competitor company win the energy contract bid nor the completion of construction by the construction company lead to the renewable energy facility becoming operational, the solar company does not protest the energy contract bid
Rule10: Either the congressional committee reviews the energy contract bid or the congressional committee investigates the energy contract bid
Rule11: If the congressional committee investigates the energy contract bid, then the congressional committee recommends rebidding the energy contract

Rule12: If the congressional committee recommends rebidding the energy contract, then provided that neither a competitor company wins the energy contract bid nor the construction company completing construction leads to the renewable energy facility becoming operational, the solar company does not protest the energy contract bid
Rule13: If the president vetoes the renewable energy bill, then when federal funding is not available, solar research does not receive government funding
Rule14: If the renewable energy facility becomes operational, then federal funding becomes available
Rule15: Either the construction company completes construction of the renewable energy facility or the renewable energy facility begins operations
Rule16: If the renewable energy facility begins operations, then the renewable energy facility becomes operational
Rule17: If the EPA conducts an inspection of the renewable energy facility, then the EPA issues certification to the renewable energy facility
Rule18: If the EPA conducts an inspection of the renewable energy facility, then the EPA issues a violation to the renewable energy facility
Rule19: If the EPA issues a violation to the renewable energy facility, then the renewable energy facility does not violate EPA regulations

Rule20: Should neither a competitor company win the energy contract bid nor the construction company completing construction lead to the renewable energy facility becoming operational, then the solar company protests the energy contract bid
Rule21: If the construction company completing construction does not lead to the renewable energy facility becoming operational, then the renewable energy facility violates EPA regulations
Rule22: Provided that the absence of federal funding does not result in the solar industry receiving tax credits, then the solar industry files a lawsuit against the government
Rule23: Given that the absence of federal funding does not lead to the solar industry receiving tax credits, the solar industry does not file a lawsuit against the government
Rule24: If federal funding is not available, then solar research receives government funding
Rule25: If federal funding is not available, then the coal power plant remains active
Rule26: If federal funding is not available, then the solar industry does not receive tax credits
facts: Fact1: The governor declares an energy emergency
Fact2: The EPA conducts an inspection of the renewable energy facility
Fact3: The energy department does not implement emergency measures
Fact4: The governor does not activate the national guard
Fact5: A competitor company does not win the energy contract bid
